Report Abuse Google is becoming what Microsoft once was- a giant corporation that wants to control everything we do on computers. But it's even worse, because it has a close relationship with the liberal portions of our government, and is expanding beyond just the computer realm into the real world. And its only significant opponents are Microsoft and Facebook, which aren't really any better at this point. This move is a big one for ol' Google, as Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin have long run the company as a trio, an approach Page articulated quite clearly in the company's 2004 IPO filing: We run Google as a triumvirate. The three of us run the company collaboratively with Sergey Brin and me as presidents. The structure is unconventional, but we have worked successfully in this way. Though it goes against Google's well-worn techniques, Shmidt claims the reorganization won't hurt the company's mojo. In fact, he believes the new management structure will speed up the decision making process.

was raided, I wrote on Twitter as a sort of joke that it was a good thing all the best stuff was safely in Bloomsbury. But this is really not very funny: On Jan. 28, as protesters clashed with police early on in the turmoil and burned down the adjacent headquarters of Mr Mubarak's ruling party, a handful of looters climbed a fire escape to the Cairo museum roof and lowered themselves on ropes from a glass-paneled ceiling onto the museum's top floor.
